posts.name: Peter
posts.cooked:
Hello!

How does one know the proper length rivet to use when assembling a robot? This is our teams first year ever riveting anything on a bot and we aren’t certain. For instance, could we rivet a 1/8 in thick gusset to a piece of max tube (0.04 in) with a rivet 1/2 in long?

Note: We would like to be able to take this robot apart next year, but we already know bolts won’t work in our situation…

Thanks!

EDIT: 1/8 in gusset, not 1/4 in

posts.name: Andrew Lawrence
posts.cooked: Rivets are measured in grip length, which typically is a range of material thickness options. Find one that fits the grip range of the material thicknesses you need and use those.

posts.name: Peter
posts.cooked: If we have a rivet over the recommended length, can we still use it? Are there any issues with using a 1/2 in rivet where a .390 one would be more applicable?

posts.name: Ari Meles-Braverman
posts.cooked: It won’t be as strong of a clamping connection as the properly sized rivet. But IMO for FRC we’re not doing the math on clamping or shear strength anyway, so you can use over- or under-sized rivets without any problems. This especially if you’re like my team, who likes to throw a million rivets in every gusset because “they don’t add weight so why not”

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor

posts.custom_user_title: FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor

posts.name: CEF
posts.cooked:
(1) Use aluminum rivets.  They’re easy to drill out.    Never mind next year – you’ll drill them out multiple times THIS season. (2) a 1/4 inch thick gusset is really thick.  Are you sure about that? (3) You would use a rivet like this one: Standard, Dome head rivet, Aluminum - Aluminum mandrel, 5/32" diameter, 1/4" - 3/8" (56) - Bolt Depot

In general, it’s better to use a rivet that’s too long than one that’s too short.

link_counts.title: Standard, Dome head rivet, Aluminum - Aluminum mandrel, 5/32" diameter, 1/4" - 3/8" (56) - Bolt Depot

posts.name: AllenGregoryIV
posts.cooked:
This is our preferred rivet style - BlindRivetSupply

3/16" - 0.187 - 0.437in Multi Grip rivets. These work pretty well for most FRC applications (when doing 2x 1/4" plates it doesn’t hold that well). We also have similar rivets that are countersunk.

In general, I believe that using too long of a rivet is preferred to using too short of a rivet.

link_counts.title: Marson Klik-Fast AB63-67MGV Multi-Grip Blind Rivet; 3/16 Inch (0.187 Inch), (0.187 - 0.437 Inch Grip), Button Head, Aluminum/Steel, Plain

posts.name: Peter
posts.cooked: Sorry! that was supposed to say 1/8. It’s changed now. Would the rivets you linked still be applicable?

posts.name: Zach Hoegberg
posts.cooked: The listed grip range is 0.187-0.437in. 1/8in is 0.125, so if you are connecting the gusset to anything between .062in and .312in, those rivets would be appropriate.

posts.name: Andrew Lawrence
posts.cooked: If your total thickness is 0.125 + 0.040 (0.165), you’re much better off using a rivet with a grip range of 0.125 - 0.250, such as WCP-0449 . If you’re referring to diameter, 1/2" is huge for FRC purposes.

posts.name: John Hascall (he)
posts.cooked:
CEF:

a 1/4 inch thick gusset is really thick
